briefdescription.para: Callback function for Call::SetStatusChangedCallback.
Uninitialized instance of Call.
Move constructor for Call.
Move assignment operator for Call.
Returns true if the instance contains a valid object.
Copy constructor for Call.
Copy assignment operator for Call.
Returns whether the call is configured to use voice auto detection or push to talk for the current user.
Returns the ID of the lobby with which this call is associated.
Returns the ID of the lobby with which this call is associated.
Returns whether the current user has locally muted the given userId for themselves.
Returns a list of all of the user IDs of the participants in the call.
Returns the locally set playout volume of the given userId.

detaileddescription.para: Does not affect the volume of this user for any other connected clients. The range of volume is [0, 200], where 100 indicate default audio volume of the playback device.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether push to talk is currently active, meaning the user is currently pressing their configured push to talk key.
Returns the time that PTT is active after the user releases the PTT key and SetPTTActive(false) is called.
Returns whether the current user is deafened.
Returns whether the current user's microphone is muted.
Returns the current call status.

detaileddescription.para: A call is not ready to be used until the status changes to "Connected".

briefdescription.para: Returns the current configuration for void auto detection thresholds. See the description of the VADThreshold struct for specifics.
Returns a reference to the VoiceStateHandle for the user ID of the given call participant.

detaileddescription.para: The VoiceStateHandle allows other users to know if the target user has muted or deafened themselves.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether to use voice auto detection or push to talk for the current user on this call.

detaileddescription.para: If using push to talk you should call SetPTTActive() whenever the user presses their confused push to talk key.

briefdescription.para: Locally mutes the given userId, so that the current user cannot hear them anymore.

detaileddescription.para: Does not affect whether the given user is muted for any other connected clients.

briefdescription.para: Sets a callback function to generally be invoked whenever a field on a VoiceStateHandle object for a user would have changed.

detaileddescription.para: For example when a user mutes themselves, all other connected clients will invoke the VoiceStateChanged callback, because the "self mute" field will be true now. The callback is generally not invoked when users join or leave channels.

briefdescription.para: Sets a callback function to be invoked whenever some joins or leaves a voice call.
Locally changes the playout volume of the given userId.

detaileddescription.para: Does not affect the volume of this user for any other connected clients. The range of volume is [0, 200], where 100 indicate default audio volume of the playback device.

briefdescription.para: When push to talk is enabled, this should be called whenever the user pushes or releases their configured push to talk key. This key must be configured in the game, the SDK does not handle keybinds itself.
If set, extends the time that PTT is active after the user releases the PTT key and SetPTTActive(false) is called.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to no release delay, but we recommend setting to 20ms, which is what Discord uses.

briefdescription.para: Mutes all audio from the currently active call for the current user. They will not be able to hear any other participants, and no other participants will be able to hear the current user either.
Mutes the current user's microphone so that no other participant in their active calls can hear them.
Sets a callback function to be invoked whenever a user starts or stops speaking and is passed in the userId and whether they are currently speaking.

detaileddescription.para: It can be invoked in other cases as well, such as if the priority speaker changes or if the user plays a soundboard sound.

briefdescription.para: Sets a callback function to be invoked when the call status changes, such as when it fully connects or starts reconnecting.
Customizes the void auto detection thresholds for picking up activity from a user's mic.

listitem.para: When automatic is set to True, Discord will automatically detect the appropriate threshold to use.
When automatic is set to False, the given threshold value will be used. Threshold has a range of -100, 0, and defaults to -60.

briefdescription.para: Converts the Error enum to a string.
Converts the Status enum to a string.
Class that manages an active voice session in a Lobby.
